div.p: I didn’t wake up and think you know I want to be an architect; when it got to the stage of figuring out what I wanted to do, so probably 6th Form level
because you have to start specialising in certain subjects, I knew that I could draw technically and I like to be creative so those two combined
and also I had a bit of a scientific mindset as well and those three combined seemed perfect for the architectural profession.
I’ve got a few artist friends and they’re quite happy to live a sort of bread-and-butter lifestyle so, you know, they’re quite poor but they’re happy to be so
but I’d kind of like to not return to the lifestyle that I had and even when I’ve got my degree and things like that you don’t necessarily have to be
an architect you can be a graphic designer, illustrator, photographer, it kind of allows me to go in any direction. As a sort of student/work
like trainee I’m still figuring it all out so that’s probably the best answer I can give
